intro: Wahlenbergia zeyheri var. krebsiana, commonly known as the Narrowleaf Bellflower, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its flowers are usually blue or purple, and it blooms during the cooler months. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries.
